CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 1-4 To achieve high power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) , electrondonor polymers should have the following desirable characteristics : ( i ) good absorption spectral overlap with the solar spectrum , ( ii ) optimal energy level alignment with respect to electron - acceptor fullerene derivatives ( typically [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC 60 BM ) or [6,6]-phenyl-C71butyric acid methyl ester ( PC 70 BM ) ) to facilitate efficient exciton separation , ( iii ) formation of a nanoscale interpenetrating network of the polymer and fullerene domains inside the photoactive layer , and ( iv ) provision of effective charge transport carriers toward the electrodes.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| ------------ |
| electrodonor polymers |
| [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC 60 BM) |
| [6,6]-phenyl-C71butyric acid methyl ester (PC 70 BM) |
| fullerene derivatives |
| [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC 60 BM) |
| [6,6]-phenyl-C71butyric acid methyl ester (PC 70 BM) |
| photoactive layer |
| nanoscale interpenetrating network |
| polymer and fullerene domains |
| effective charge transport carriers |
| electrodes |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| ------------ |
| electrodonor polymers |
| [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC 60 BM) |
| [6,6]-phenyl-C71butyric acid methyl ester (PC 70 BM) |
| fullerene derivatives ([6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC 60 BM) and [6,6]-phenyl-C71butyric acid methyl ester (PC 70 BM)) |
| photoactive layer (containing the interpenetrating network of polymer and fullerene domains) |
| effective charge transport carriers |

Paragraph: 1-4 To achieve high power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) , electrondonor polymers should have the following desirable characteristics : ( i ) good absorption spectral overlap with the solar spectrum , ( ii ) optimal energy level alignment with respect to electron - acceptor fullerene derivatives ( typically [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC 60 BM ) or [6,6]-phenyl-C71butyric acid methyl ester ( PC 70 BM ) ) to facilitate efficient exciton separation , ( iii ) formation of a nanoscale interpenetrating network of the polymer and fullerene domains inside the photoactive layer , and ( iv ) provision of effective charge transport carriers toward the electrodes.
